title: üîç Detective Amy #1: The Missing Cookies
content:
Amy loves to solve mysteries. She is only 10 years old, but everyone calls her "Detective Amy."

One day, her mom baked chocolate cookies. She put them on the kitchen table. But when Amy came home from school, the cookies were GONE!

"Who took my cookies?" Mom asked.

Amy looked around. She saw brown crumbs on the floor. The crumbs made a trail. Amy followed the trail... to the dog's bed!

There was Max, the family dog. He had chocolate on his nose!

"I found the cookie thief!" Amy laughed. "It's Max!"

Mom said, "Good job, Detective Amy. But Max can't eat chocolate. It's bad for dogs!"

Amy learned something new: chocolate is dangerous for dogs. She gave Max a dog treat instead.

questions.explain: The story says 'everyone calls her Detective Amy.'
Mom's chocolate cookies were gone from the table.

questions.q: How did Amy know Max took the cookies?
questions.b: She followed the crumbs to Max's bed
questions.explain: Amy followed the trail of crumbs to Max's bed and saw chocolate on his nose.
Mom explained that chocolate is bad for dogs.

title: üîç Detective Amy #2: The Disappearing Lunch
content:
Something strange was happening at school. Every day, someone's lunch disappeared!

On Monday, Ben's sandwich was gone. On Tuesday, Sara's apple vanished. On Wednesday, even the teacher's salad disappeared!

"We need Detective Amy!" the students said.

Amy began her investigation. She asked questions. "When did your lunch disappear?" Everyone said the same thing: "During morning recess."

Amy had an idea. On Thursday, she stayed inside during recess. She hid behind the bookshelf and watched.

Soon, the classroom door opened slowly. A small figure came in. It was... a squirrel!

The furry thief grabbed a banana from Tom's lunchbox. It ran out the window!

Amy told the teacher. They closed the window. No more lunches disappeared after that!

"Another mystery solved!" Amy said proudly.

questions.explain: Everyone said their lunch disappeared during morning recess.
Amy hid behind the bookshelf to watch.
A squirrel was coming through the window to steal food.

questions.q: How did they stop the thief?
questions.explain: They closed the window so the squirrel couldn't get in anymore.

title: üîç Detective Amy #3: The Lost Homework
content:
It was Friday morning. Tom looked very sad. "I can't find my math homework!" he cried. "I put it on my desk last night."

Detective Amy was ready to help. "Don't worry, Tom. I will find it."

Amy went to Tom's house. She looked at his desk. It was very messy. There were toys, books, and papers everywhere.

"Did you open the window last night?" Amy asked.

"Yes, it was hot," Tom said.

Amy looked out the window. She saw a piece of paper stuck in the bush outside.

"Look!" Amy pointed. "The wind blew your homework out the window!"

Tom ran outside and got the paper. It was his math homework!

"Thank you, Amy!" Tom said. "Next time, I will clean my desk!"

questions.explain: Tom cried because he couldn't find his math homework.

questions.q: Why did the homework fly out the window?
questions.b: The wind blew it because the window was open
questions.explain: Amy realized the wind blew it out because the window was open.
Tom said 'Next time, I will clean my desk!'

title: üîç Detective Amy #4: The Vanishing Chalk
content:
Mr. Lee, the art teacher, was confused. "I bought a new box of colorful chalk yesterday," he said. "Now it is empty!"

Amy looked at the empty box. She saw colorful dust on the floor. It led to the playground.

Amy and Mr. Lee walked to the playground. They saw three little students drawing pictures on the ground.

"Look!" said one student. "We made a rainbow!"

They were using Mr. Lee's chalk!

"We didn't know it was yours," said the little girl. "We found it on the table."

Mr. Lee smiled. "The pictures are beautiful. But next time, please ask first."

Amy smiled too. The mystery was solved, and the playground looked very colorful.

questions.q: What was missing from the art room?
questions.explain: Mr. Lee said his new box of colorful chalk was empty.
They found three little students using the chalk on the playground.

questions.b: No, he smiled and liked the pictures
questions.explain: Mr. Lee smiled and said the pictures were beautiful, but asked them to ask permission next time.

title: üîç Detective Amy #5: The Playground Thief
content:
A serious crime happened at school. The soccer ball was gone! Then the basketball was gone! Finally, the jump ropes were gone!

"Who makes all the sports equipment disappear?" the gym teacher asked.

Amy looked for clues. She found footprints near the shed. They were too big for a squirrel. They looked like... boots.

Amy waited by the shed after school. She saw a shadow moving.

"Stop!" Amy shouted.

The shadow turned around. It was the new janitor, Mr. Grumpy. He was holding the balls.

"I'm sorry," Mr. Grumpy said as he put them back. "The kids leave them in the rain. I was just putting them away so they don't get ruined."

Amy felt bad. He wasn't stealing. He was helping!

"We misunderstood you," Amy said. "Thank you for taking care of our things."

questions.b: Soccer ball, basketball, and jump ropes
questions.explain: The story lists sports equipment that went missing.

questions.q: Why did Amy think the thief wasn't a squirrel?
questions.a: The footprints were too big and looked like boots
questions.explain: She found footprints that were too big for a squirrel and looked like boots.

questions.q: Why was Mr. Grumpy taking the balls?
questions.c: He was protecting them from the rain
questions.explain: He said he was putting them away so they don't get ruined by the rain.

questions.a: Amy thought he was stealing, but he was cleaning up
questions.explain: Amy realized he wasn't stealing; he was helping take care of the equipment.
